racial_traits.name: Dwarven Toughness
racial_traits.description: Our hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

racial_traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
racial_traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

racial_traits.name: Stonecunning
racial_traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence(History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check.

racial_traits.name: Fey Ancestry
racial_traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

racial_traits.name: Trance
racial_traits.description:
Elves don’t need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is “trance.”) While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises 
that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

racial_traits.name: Lucky
racial_traits.description: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can re-roll the die and must use the new roll.

racial_traits.name: Brave
racial_traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

racial_traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
racial_traits.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

racial_traits.name: Naturally Stealthy
racial_traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

racial_traits_choices.name: Draconic Ancestry
racial_traits_choices.description: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

racial_traits_choices.name: Breath Weapon
racial_traits_choices.description: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation. When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful

racial_traits_choices.name: Damage Resistance
racial_traits_choices.description: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

racial_traits.name: Gnomish Cunning
racial_traits.description: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

racial_traits.name: Artificer's Lore
racial_traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

racial_traits.name: Tinker
racial_traits.description: You have proficiency with artisan’s tools (tinker’s tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose one of the following options: Clockwork Toy. This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents. Fire Starter. The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action. Music Box. When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song’s end or when it is closed.
